title: Eleanor Tomlinson shows off her long legs in a sexy leather miniskirt and matching biker jacket
text:
She is best known as Demelza on the hit show, Poldark.

And Eleanor Tomlinson looked incredible as she attended the opening of the Belstaff Flagship store launch on Regent Street, London on Thursday night.

The actress, 27, showed off her sexy side in a racy black leather miniskirt and elongated biker jacket.

Saucy: Eleanor Tomlinson, 27, looked incredible as she attended the opening of the Belstaff Flagship store launch on Regent Street, London on Thursday night

Eleanor looked incredible in the over-sized outerwear which boasted cropped sleeve. She wore it atop a simple black tee.

Her matching miniskirt, which featured an exposed zipper down the front, put focus on her toned legs which she boosted in a pair of towering heels.

Eleanor relied on her naturally striking features with a simple slick of make-up, which complemented her tousled flowing tresses.

Pretty: Eleanor relied on her naturally striking features with a simple slick of make-up, which complemented her tousled flowing tresses

Eleanor's sighting comes after fans of Poldark slammed the BBC1 drama's finale in August.

The series, based on the novels of Winston Graham, focused on the burgeoning relationship between Cornwall gentleman Ross Poldark (Aidan Turner) and his scullery maid turned wife, Demelza (Eleanor Tomlinson).

Over five seasons, it set pulses racing with its love triangles, bedroom romps and upstairs-downstairs affairs.

There be is! Professor Green was also in attendance, donning a two-toned jacket and casual bottoms

Happy: The hitmaker couldn't contain his smiles at the event

Trendsetter: Betty Bachz showed off her style credentials in a blacker belted biker jacket and lace skirt

Handsome: Paul Sculfor cut a stylish figure in a poloneck

But viewers were left disappointed by the final episode, which saw Poldark take on the role of double-agent in order to trick the French, with many commenting on the 'confusing' plot and 'bad' scriptwriting.

One wrote: 'I know I can press the off button, but I've been a fan of #Poldark for 40 years and counting. The awful travesty of this final episode of an indifferent, odd and disconnected series five is like hypnosis.

They added: 'I'm appalled but can't look away. What have they done?'
